plugins.name: Feature-Labeler
plugins.description:
Create numbered badges and description frames for your wireframes with ease. Streamline your design documentation process by adding sequential numbered references to features and their explanations. Convenient for product specifications, user flow documentation, and design handoffs.


  1. Create a Number Badge
  2. Select the badge size (small, medium, or large)
  3. Choose a color from preset options or use the color picker
  4. Click "Create" to add a numbered badge to your design
  5. Create a Description Frame
  6. Select the frame size (small, medium, or large)
  7. Click "Create" to add a description frame with a matching number
  8. Edit Badges and Descriptions
  9. Click on any badge or description frame to edit
  10. Change numbers to reorder the sequence automatically
  11. For badges, you can also update the color
  12. Organize Documentation
  13. Place badges next to UI elements you want to reference
  14. Add explanatory text in the description frames
  15. Badges and descriptions with the same number are linked in the sequence


와이어프레임에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지와 설명 프레임을 쉽게 생성하세요. 기능과 설명에 순차적인 번호 참조를 추가하여 디자인 문서화 프로세스를 간소화합니다. 제품 사양, 사용자 플로우 문서화 및 디자인 인계에 편리하게 활용할 수 있습니다.


  1. 번호 뱃지 만들기
  2. 뱃지 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  3. 미리 설정된 색상 중에서 선택하거나 색상 선택기 사용
  4. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 디자인에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지 추가
  5. 설명 프레임 만들기
  6. 프레임 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  7. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 일치하는 번호의 설명 프레임 추가
  8. 뱃지 및 설명 편집
  9. 편집하려는 뱃지나 설명 프레임을 클릭
  10. 번호를 변경하면 시퀀스가 자동으로 재정렬됨
  11. 뱃지의 경우 색상도 업데이트 가능
  12. 문서 정리
  13. 참조하려는 UI 요소 옆에 뱃지 배치
  14. 설명 프레임에 설명 텍스트 추가
  15. 같은 번호의 뱃지와 설명은 시퀀스에서 연결됨
plugins.tagline: Simplify wireframe annotations with numbered badges and descriptions

plugins.name: iconSync
plugins.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assets—especially icons—can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

🎯 One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


🧠 Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


🔁 Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

⚙️ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


⚠️ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents → `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata → `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests → `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


You’ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner – your GitHub username or organization name

API Key – your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name – usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name – a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name – the target GitHub repository

Store Path – the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, you’re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you won’t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
plugins.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Magic Style Guide
plugins.description:
✨ Magic Style Guide ✨

Create beautiful, clear, professional style guides — in just one click.


Magic Style Guide reads all your color variables (across multiple collections, including linked variables) and text styles to instantly generate an elegant, organized, and ready-to-share style guide.

Perfect for onboarding, documentation, and developer handoff — without any manual work.


---


🔮 Features:


- One-click magic: Instantly document all text styles and color variables.

- Smart descriptions: Auto-generate usage notes based on your style names.

- Linked variables support: Handles both direct and linked variables across collections.

- Multi-collection ready: Organizes styles beautifully even when they span several collections.

- Beautiful output: Clean, professional, and fully structured style guides.


---


Why you'll love it:

Save hours of boring documentation.

Keep your design systems clear, consistent, and ready for scale.

Focus on design — Magic Style Guide takes care of the rest. 🎩✨
plugins.tagline: Generate stunning style guides from Figma styles and variables — instantly!

🖋️ Text Style Layout Glow-Up
I gave the text styles section a makeover. It’s now sharper, more elegant, and way easier to scan. Like a well-dressed typeface at a job interview.

🧠 Smart Descriptions for Humans
Now automatically adds short, helpful descriptions based on text sizes and color names. No more guessing what “Primary / Surface / Subtle” actually means.

🪄 New Plugin UI (because vibes matter)
The plugin window got a redesign — cleaner layout, a proper call-to-action, and even a lovely image… just for the aesthetic. Nothing essential, but everything nice.

plugins.name: Smart Selection
plugins.description:
Smart Selection is a powerful tool for designers that allows flexible filtering of elements based on multiple parameters: dimensions, names, types, properties, and even child element content.


The plugin enables you to:

  1. Filter elements by exact values, ranges, and regular expressions
  2. Find objects with specific child elements
  3. Save, load, and combine sets of selected elements
  4. Export and import selection sets to share between files and teams
  5. Use an intuitive interface with convenient filters


Essential for working with complex designs when you need to quickly find elements with specific characteristics — save time on routine selection tasks and start working more efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Advanced element selection by parameters and saving selection sets for quick reuse.

plugins.name: Fill Cleaner
plugins.description:
Fill Cleaner helps you maintain clean, efficient Figma files by removing redundant fills from layers. Whether it’s multiple image fills, solid colors, or gradients, the plugin preserves only the topmost fill of each type—no visual changes, just a lighter file.


✨ Smart Fill Cleaning

  1. Image fills: Keep the topmost image
  2. Color fills: Remove redundant solids
  3. Gradient fills: Retain just the top gradient
  4. CMD+K for quick commands
  5. Batch cleaning: Works on selections or entire pages


🖼️ Lummi.ai Integration

  1. Instantly apply images to selected layers
  2. Great for refreshing mockups and prototypes


🕒 When to Use

  1. Design cleanup: Tidy up before handoff
  2. File optimization: Reduce size, speed up performance
  3. After explorations: Clear leftover fills
  4. Before sharing: Ensure your files are clean
  5. With imports: Fix cluttered layers from other tools


Try Image Fill Cleaner and keep your designs sharp, efficient, and handoff-ready.
plugins.tagline: Remove extra image, color, and gradient fills. Works on selections or entire pages with ease.

plugins.name: MagicText
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by recognizing, transforming, and cleaning up text layers in seconds. Whether you're extracting text from images, converting case styles, or refining typography, this tool enhances productivity and ensures design consistency with just a few clicks.


How It Works:


1. Text Recognition

Use the built-in text recognize to quickly extract text from image layers. Simply select an image layer, choose the desired language, and launch text recognition – the plugin will automatically create a new text layer with the extracted content.

Supported Languages: MagicText supports a wide range of languages: English, Chinese, Ukrainian, Spanish, German, French, Japanese, Korean, Arabic, Portuguese, Italian, Bulgarian, Greek, Hebrew, Hindi, Turkish and more.


2. Text Transformation:

Easily change the case of your text with a single click:

  1. Title Case: Capitalize the first letter of each word.
  2. Sentence Case: Capitalize only the first letter of each sentence.
  3. UPPERCASE & lowercase: Convert your text to all uppercase or all lowercase letters.


3. Text Manipulation:

Seamlessly merge multiple text layers into one or split a single text layer into individual sentences for easier editing.


4. Style Cleanup:

  1. Remove Hyperlinks: Automatically strip out hyperlinks from your text.
  2. Remove All Styles: Reset text and color styles, reverting your text to a clean, default appearance.


5. Character Counter:

Instantly see the number of characters, sentences, and words in your selected text layers for precise text management.


Key Features:

  1. Image-Based Text Recognition: Extract text from images with support for multiple languages.
  2. Case Conversion Options: Transform text to sentence case, title case, UPPERCASE, or lowercase in just a few clicks.
  3. Text Layer Manipulation: Merge and split text layers effortlessly to suit your workflow.
  4. Style Reset: Remove hyperlinks and reset text formatting to maintain consistency in your designs.
  5. Real-Time Character Counting: Keep track of characters, sentences, and words in real time.


Who Is It For?

MagicText is designed for Figma designers who want to streamline their text formatting and editing process. By automating repetitive tasks and offering powerful text transformation tools, MagicText allows you to focus more on creative design and less on manual text adjustments.


Feedback & Future Updates

Welcome your professional insights and suggestions for improvements. Your feedback is invaluable and will be carefully reviewed to guide future updates. Please share your ideas and help us enhance MagicText. Leave your feedback here.
plugins.tagline: Recognize, transform, and clean text layers instantly—enhancing productivity and consistency.

plugins.name: QR Code Figma
plugins.description:
QR Code Generator for Figma


Create beautiful, customizable QR codes directly in Figma with this powerful plugin. Perfect for designers, marketers, and developers who need to quickly generate and place QR codes in their designs.


Features

✨ Instant Generation

- Generate QR codes in seconds

- Support for URLs, text, and more

- Real-time preview


🎨 Full Customization

- Custom colors for both foreground and background

- Adjustable size and margin

- Multiple border styles (solid, dashed, none)

- Custom border width

- Dark/Light mode support


🖼️ Logo Integration

- Add your brand logo to QR codes

- Automatic logo sizing and positioning

- Maintain QR code readability


📱 Multiple Formats

- High-quality output

- Optimized for both print and digital


📋 History & Management

- Save your recent QR codes

- Quick access to previous designs

- Easy history management


Use Cases

- Marketing materials

- Business cards

- Product packaging

- Event tickets

- Digital menus

- Website designs


How to Use

1. Enter your text or URL

Perfect For

- Anyone who needs professional QR codes quickly

plugins.name: Countastic
plugins.description:
Countastic is the ultimate Figma calculator plugin, built to help product designers create data-centric products and screens faster and more efficiently.


Add, subtract, calculate averages and percentages automatically and use them in your designs with a single click, making the data on screen believable and relevant to your customers, stakeholders and usability test participants.


A must have for any designer sweating the details of data tables, sales and analytics dashboards, finance or e-commerce products.


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Get started

Countastic performs calculations on objects selected in your Figma file, showing you results you can copy or place on the canvas with a single click.


Open Countastic and:

  1. Select two or more text objects in your Figma file
  2. See the sum, difference, average and percentage difference of the selected objects.
  3. Click the result of a calculation to copy to clipboard
  4. Click the “Place” button beside the calculation to add the result to the canvas


Countastic works with:

  1. Currencies (including US, UK and European separator and decimal point styles)
  2. Units of measure
  3. Any numerical values containing prefixes or suffixes


Countastic helps you calculate:

  1. Sums
  2. Differences
  3. Averages
  4. Percentage differences (between 2 objects only)


Get the license

(7 day trial, team discounts available)


Questions and feedback

Countastic requires no setup, allowing you to hit the ground running and use relevant, real-looking data in your designs.


If you have feedback about Countastic or want to share an idea or a feature request, drop me a line on X, Bluesky or Threads.
plugins.tagline: A fully-automated calculator inside Figma

plugins.name: Usably
plugins.description:
Usably: Instant UX Feedback Powered by AI


Get actionable insights to improve usability, accessibility, and visual consistency—all without needing an API key!


This plugin analyzes your design against core UX principles like Hick's Law, Jakob's Law, and more.


How It Works:

  1. Select an area: Choose a single frame or an entire flow with multiple frames.
  2. Click "Review Design": Start the analysis with just one click.
  3. Get feedback: Usably generates comprehensive, actionable feedback to refine your design.


Key Features:

✅ Easy setup: NO API key needed - Install the plugin, sign up with your email, and start reviewing in seconds.

✅ Advanced UX analysis: Incorporates proven UX laws for better design decisions.


The subscription and payment of the plugin is managed by Figma marketplace. You can follow their help center to unsubscribe.


🦄 Free plan includes 5 reviews, paid subscription includes 100 reviews per month.


💌 Need help? Reach out to the Usably team at usably.team@gmail.com.
plugins.tagline: AI-powered UX reviews with insights—no API key needed. Install and start improving your designs!

plugins.name: Rename From Sublayer
plugins.description:
Rename from sublayers simplifies the process of renaming groups in Figma by automatically detecting image, text or shape layers within selected groups.


You can choose between five modes: image detection, text layer, Rectangle layer, ellipse layer and symbols detection.

Additionally, you can opt to rename all child groups within the hierarchy or just the top-level group, giving you full control over your naming conventions.


Key Features:

  1. Image, Text, Shape Detection: Automatically rename groups based on image names, text names, rectangle names, ellipse names and symbols.
  2. Selective Renaming: Choose to rename just the highest-level group or all nested child groups.
  3. User-Friendly Interface: Simple and intuitive UI to quickly toggle between options.


Whether you're managing large design systems or working on a small project, Rename from sublayers helps keep your layers organized and your workflow efficient.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly rename groups by image, text or shape layers.

plugins.name: Naming Helper
plugins.description:
# Naming Helper - 피그마 플러그인


선택된 프레임(들) 내의 모든 요소 이름을 한 번에 변경할 수 있는 피그마 플러그인입니다.


## 기능


- 선택된 프레임 내의 모든 하위 요소 이름을 일괄 변경

- 여러 프레임을 동시에 선택하여 일괄 처리 가능

- 현재 선택된 프레임 개수 표시

- 프레임이 선택되지 않았을 경우 알림 제공


## 사용 방법


1. 이름을 변경하고자 하는 프레임(들)을 선택합니다.

2. 플러그인을 실행합니다.

3. 입력 필드에 새로운 이름을 입력합니다.

4. "이름 변경하기" 버튼을 클릭합니다.

5. 프레임 내의 모든 요소 이름이 변경됩니다.
plugins.tagline: Naming Helper

plugins.name: Text to Frame Name
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin “Text to Frame Name” is a handy tool that allows you to replace selected text with the name of the highest-level frame it belongs to, all at once. This is particularly useful for page numbers in presentation materials or proposals. For example, you can set frame names with sequential numbers like “01,” “02,” and “03,” place temporary text (e.g., “00”) on each page, select all the text, and run this plugin to complete page numbering. Even if you reorder or add pages, you can easily reset the numbers by simply modifying the frame names. This eliminates the need for manual number adjustments, significantly improving workflow efficiency.


Figmaプラグイン「Text to Frame Name」は、選択したテキストを、それぞれが属する最上位のフレーム名に一括で置き換えることができる便利なツールです。主にプレゼンテーション資料や提案書などのページ番号で役立ちます。たとえば「01」「02」「03」など連番がついたフレーム名にしておき、各ページに仮のテキスト（例：00）を配置し、すべてのテキストを選択してこのプラグインを実行するだけで、ページ番号制作が完了します。ページを入れ替えたり追加したりしても、フレーム名さえ修正すれば簡単に番号を再設定可能。手動で番号を修正する必要がなくなり、作業効率が大きく向上します。
plugins.tagline: Auto-convert text layers to parent frame names

130123.description:

Even if you reorder or add pages, you can easily reset the numbers by simply modifying the frame names. Figmaプラグイン「Text to Frame Name」は、選択したテキストを、それぞれが属する最上位のフレーム名に一括で置き換えることができる便利なツールです。主にプレゼンテーション資料や提案書などのページ番号で役立ちます。たとえば「01」「02」「03」など連番がついたフレーム名にしておき、各ページに仮のテキスト（例：00）を配置し、すべてのテキストを選択してこのプラグインを実行するだけで、ページ番号制作が完了します。ページを入れ替えたり追加したりしても、フレーム名さえ修正すれば簡単に番号を再設定可能。手動で番号を修正する必要がなくなり、作業効率が大きく向上します。
130123.tagline: Auto-convert text layers to parent frame names

plugins.name: Chroma Forge
plugins.description:
Chroma Forge for Figma


A powerful color selection plugin for Figma that provides an intuitive color wheel and advanced color harmony tools to create consistent color palettes.


Features


Interactive Color Wheel

  1. High-precision color selection with a fully interactive color wheel
  2. Adjustable brightness and saturation sliders
  3. Real-time color preview
  4. HEX code input with validation


Color Harmony Tools

  1. Create cohesive color palettes using different harmony types:
  2. Analogous: Colors that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel
  3. Triad: Three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  4. Complementary: Colors opposite each other on the color wheel
  5. Split Complementary: A main color and two colors adjacent to its complement
  6. Square: Four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  7. Compound: A combination of complementary and analogous harmonies
  8. Mono: A single color with various shades
  9. Custom: Create your own custom harmony by placing markers freely


Flexible Color Selection

  1. Select 2-6 colors at once (depending on harmony type)
  2. Drag markers on the wheel to fine-tune your color selection
  3. Automatic contrast adjustment for optimal visibility


Figma Integration

  1. Apply selected colors directly to selected elements
  2. Create color styles from your palette
  3. Generate color variables with automatic shade variants (10% to 100% brightness)
  4. Intelligent naming system for organizing colors


How to Use


Select a Harmony Type: Choose from the dropdown menu to define how colors relate to each other

Select Number of Colors: Choose how many colors you want in your palette (2-6)

Choose Your Base Color: Click and drag on the color wheel or enter a HEX code

Adjust Saturation and Brightness: Use the sliders to fine-tune your colors

Apply Colors: Use the buttons to:

  1. Apply directly to selected elements
  2. Add to Figma color styles
  3. Add to Figma variables (with automatic shade creation)


Email me

Behance

Dribbble

LinkedIn

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Create perfect palettes with color harmony tools

plugins.name: Your AI Co-Pilot
plugins.description:
Your AI Co-Pilot provides instant design feedback directly within Figma. Select any design elements to receive AI-powered analysis across four key areas:


• UI Design: Visual hierarchy, color usage, spacing, and consistency

• Content: Readability, clarity, and copy suggestions

• User Experience: Usability issues and interaction patterns

• Accessibility: WCAG compliance recommendations


The plugin analyzes selected frames, components, or groups and generates actionable feedback to improve your designs. You can ask follow-up questions to get more detailed explanations or recommendations.


All analysis is performed securely through our backend API using advanced AI models. No design data is stored permanently - it's only processed temporarily during analysis.

plugins.name: Archiver
plugins.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.
plugins.tagline: Organize Design History: One-Click Element Archiving

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
To use it, simply activate the plugin, import any component from any library, and it does the rest! 🚀


https://www.loom.com/share/6d526c11f63644318e9c604193e11e3d


Effortless Token Swapping Across Files

Swap Design Tokens between your design system and working files in seconds. Maintain consistency without duplicating libraries or styles.


Full-page Token Replacement

Need to update a full design with new tokens? One click with "Swap All" updates every node, text style, and color variable instantly — no manual work required.


Intelligent Scan & Replace

Automatically scan files for elements not linked to tokens — including colors and fonts — and batch replace them with variables from your design system. Eliminate inconsistencies with a few clicks.


Cross-theme & Project Flexibility

Manage multiple projects with a single design system source. Token Swapper ensures all visual assets remain connected to their proper tokens, even across brands or themes.


Non-destructive Workflow

Token Swapper doesn’t overwrite or break your original styles. Switch between token sets and preview changes without permanent commitment — perfect for testing themes or migrating designs.


Smart Query Processing

Let the plugin process bulk token changes in the background. Your edits persist even when closing the plugin, making large updates smoother and safer.


Beta Features: More Power, More Control

Our beta tools let you go even deeper — manage font tokens, swap icons, and process entire pages. Just stay in the same token session for best results while we keep improving.


FAQs

Does this work with free Figma plans?

Yes! Token Swapper is fully compatible with all Figma plans — free included. No need for professional tiers to keep your tokens in sync.


What if I use my own token naming system?

That’s okay! As long as your token names and structure match across files, Token Swapper will recognize and replace them intelligently.


Why use Token Swapper instead of doing it manually?

Manual token swaps are time-consuming, error-prone, and hard to scale. Token Swapper automates the entire process, saving you hours of work and ensuring consistency.


Tutorials

https://www.loom.com/share/3d743648bd3643e5a50b7dff7d54bbf2

https://www.loom.com/share/b3a6f11e12734fe18da5d30106fe4c54

https://www.loom.com/share/0ec7731eb20f404d9259222377f40cef
plugins.tagline: Swaps font, color and space tokens of components imported from other libraries.

Why use Publish Ninja?

You’ve designed a website in Figma, but now you’re stuck. Either you need a developer, or you have to wrestle with complicated website builders. It’s frustrating, time-consuming, and slows you down.


Publish Ninja lets you publish fully responsive websites directly from Figma—no coding needed. With just a few clicks, your design goes live as a website.

  1. Design in Figma – Create your site just like any other Figma project.
  2. Customize responsiveness – Easily adjust layouts for mobile, tablet, and desktop.

plugins.name: Variable Length Lorem Ipsum
plugins.description:
Most text generator plugins let you specify a single number for the word count. However, sometimes you want to specify a range instead, to introduce variability, and create more realistic results (realistic for lorem ipsum text, that is)


Features:

  1. Generates lorem ipsum text with the option of varied lengths.
  2. Enter a single number (e.g., "10") for fixed word count or a range (e.g., "5-10") for random variation within limits.
  3. Optionally add punctuation for generated text (default: off).
  4. Optionally auto-close the plugin after generating text (default: off).
  5. Supports your system setting for light or dark mode.
